dict.string: Copies a given online video site’s url to the clipboard with it’s duration in square brackets

#!/bin/bash
url="$(pbpaste)"
# functions convertsecs() { ((h=${1}/3600)) ((m=(${1}%3600)/60)) ((s=${1}%60)) printf "%02dh%02dm%02ds" $h $m $s }
convertmins() { if [[ ${1} == *'m'* ]] && [[ $(echo ${1} | sed 's/m.*//') -gt 60 ]]; then mins=$(echo ${1} | sed 's/m.*//') ((h=${mins}/60)) ((m=${mins}-${h}*60))
echo ${1} | sed "s/.*m/${h}h${m}m/" else echo ${1} fi }
# domain-specific if [[ ${url} == *'youtube.com'* ]] || [[ ${url} == *'youtu.be'* ]]; then duration=$(curl --silent --location "${url}" | grep '<meta itemprop="duration"' | sed 's/.*PT//;s/">//' | tr [:upper:] [:lower:]) duration=$(convertmins "${duration}") fi
if [[ ${url} == *'vimeo.com'* ]]; then duration=$(curl --silent --location "${url}" | grep '<meta itemprop="duration"' | sed 's/.*PT//;s/">//' | tr [:upper:] [:lower:]) fi
if [[ ${url} == *'ted.com'* ]]; then duration=$(curl --silent --location "${url}" | grep '<meta property="video:duration' | sed 's/.*content="\(.*\)".*/\1/') duration=$(convertsecs "${duration}") fi
# format the time string to remove extra zeros if [[ ${duration} == '0'?'h'* ]]; then duration=$(echo ${duration} | sed 's/0//') fi
if [[ ${duration} == '0h'* ]]; then duration=$(echo ${duration} | sed 's/0h//') fi
if [[ ${duration} == '0'?'m'* ]]; then duration=$(echo ${duration} | sed 's/0//') fi
if [[ ${duration} == '0m'* ]]; then duration=$(echo ${duration} | sed 's/0m//') fi
if [[ ${duration} == '0'?'s'* ]]; then duration=$(echo ${duration} | sed 's/0//') fi
# format duration; if it's empty (probably used on an unsupported website), it'll just show the url if [[ ! -z ${duration} ]]; then duration=" [${duration}]" fi
echo -n "${url}${duration}"
Will act on the URL you have on your clipboard
